title: Instructional Design Based on an Educational Reconstruction Model for Understanding Solid-State Chemistry Concepts

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of core chemistry concepts (atomic structure, types of bonding, crystal structures, etc.)
context.additional_context: Focuses on strengthening conceptual understanding to help pre-service teachers effectively convey solid-state chemistry concepts to elementary students. Supplementary materials via smartphones are permissible

learning_goals: Learners can explain core solid-state chemistry concepts (crystal structures, bonding types, property relationships) with over 85% accuracy.
Learners can design instructional materials that reinterpret abstract concepts at an elementary level using the Educational Reconstruction Model (MER).
Learners can assess conceptual application skills and provide feedback through solid-state chemistry-related experiments/visualization activities.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
